inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

inactive-port-shutdown.description:
Enable/disable the laser auto shutdown function on the backup interface of the Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode.
After this function is enabled, the backup interface will be shut down. By default, the laser auto shutdown function is disabled.

preempt-enable.description:
Enable/disable delay switchback for the master member interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working in 1:1 master/backup mode. By default, this function is disabled. This function works together with revert delay time that can be configured only after this function is enabled.
After this function is enabled, the restored master interface automatically takes over traffic of the backup interface when the revert delay time expires.

preempt-delay-minutes.description:
Specify the delay interval (in minutes) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-seconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

preempt-delay-milliseconds.description:
Specify the delay interval (in million-seconds) at which the master interface of an Eth-Trunk interface working 1:1 master/backup mode switches back to the master state. Value 0 indicates that a master interface immediately switches back to the master state once it is restored. This time can be configured only after delay switchback is enabled.
After this time is configured, the restored master interface switches back to the master state only after the time expires, preventing frequent interface flappings and traffic loss.

aaa_schema.description: Security management, which includes the management on authentication, authorization, accounting, domains, and users.

task.description: Statistics of minimum unit for dividing rights on an NE. Tasks can be determined when an NE is delivered. Tasks cannot be customized.

name.description: Name of a task, it is not case sensitive.

task-group.description: Configure a collection of certain tasks. The default task groups cannot be removed and are set in the system before the NE delivery.

task-group-include-maps.description: List of the task groups included in a main task group.

task-group-include-map.description: Configure task group included in a main task group.

include-task-group-name.description: Name of included task group, it is not case sensitive.

task-group-task-maps.description: List of the tasks included in a task group.

task-group-task-map.description: Configure task in a task group. The default task group cannot be modified.

task-name.description: Name of a task. It must be an existing task.

read.description: To determine whether a task has the read right.

write.description: To determine whether a task has the write right.

execute.description: To determine whether a task has the operation right.

debug.description: To determine whether a task has the debug right.

user-group.description: Configure a collection of certain users. Certain default user groups are set before an NE is delivered and cannot be deleted.

user-group-task-group-maps.description: List of the task groups included in a user group.

user-group-task-group-map.description: Configure task group in a user group.

task-group-name.description: Name of a task group, it is not case sensitive.

user-group-include-maps.description: List of the user groups included in a main user group.

user-group-include-map.description: Configure user group included in a main user group.

include-user-group-name.description: Name of a user group, it is not case sensitive.

authentication-scheme.description: Configure authentication scheme. The default authentication scheme cannot be deleted.

first-authen-mode.description: Preferred authentication mode. The second, third, or fourth authentication mode is used only when the first authentication mode does not respond. The first authentication mode cannot be set to unavailable.

second-authen-mode.description: Authentication mode with the preference lower than the first authentication mode. The second authentication mode is used when the first authentication mode does not respond. If the setting of the second authentication mode is unavailable, the third and fourth authentication modes fail to be set.

third-authen-mode.description: Authentication mode with the preference lower than the first and second authentication modes. The third authentication mode is used when the first and second authentication modes do not respond. If the setting of the third authentication mode is unavailable, the fourth authentication mode fails to be set.

fourth-authen-mode.description: Authentication mode with the least preference. The fourth authentication mode is used when the first, second, and third authentication modes do not respond. If the setting of the fourth authentication mode is unavailable or the fourth authentication mode does not respond, the authentication fails.

authorization-scheme.description: Configure authorization scheme. The default authorization scheme cannot be deleted.

author-scheme-name.description: Name of an authorization scheme. The name uniquely identifies the authorization scheme and can be used in the domain.

first-author-mode.description: Preferred authorization mode. The second, third, or fourth authorization mode can be used only when the first authorization mode does not respond. The first authorization mode must be available.

second-author-mode.description: Authorization mode with the preference next to the first authorization mode. It is used when the first authorization mode does not respond. If the setting of the second authorization mode is unavailable, the third and fourth authorization modes fail to be set.

third-author-mode.description: Authorization mode with the preference next to the first and second authorization modes. It is used when the first and second authorization modes do not respond. If the setting of the third authorization mode is unavailable, the fourth authorization mode fails to be set.

fourth-author-mode.description: Authorization mode with the least preference. It is used when the first, second, and third authorization modes do not respond. If the setting of the fourth authorization mode is unavailable or the fourth authorization mode does not respond, the authorization fails.

no-lvl-first-cmd-author.description: Configures the first authorization mode for users of user group.

no-lvl-second-cmd-author.description: Configures the second authorization mode for users of user group.

no-response-policy.description: Configures a policy for a scenario where no responses are obtained during command line-based authorization.

no-response-times.description: Configures the number of times of failed authorization.

cmd-author-mode-type.description: Sorting method of cmd authorization mode.

accounting-scheme.description: Configure accounting scheme. The default accounting scheme cannot be deleted.

domain.description: Configure in a domain, users apply the same authentication/authorization scheme or server. The default domain cannot be deleted.

admin-level.description: The admin level of domain. If the command level adjustment function is disabled, the value of adminLevel ranges from 0 to 3. If the command level adjustment function is enabled, the value of adminLevel ranges from 0 to 15.

authen-scheme-name.description: Name of the authentication scheme used by the domain, it is not case sensitive. The default value varies according to domains. The default value is restored when the node is deleted.

author-scheme-name.description: Name of the authorization scheme used by the domain, it is not case sensitive. The default value varies according to domains. The default value is restored when the node is deleted.

acct-scheme-name.description: Name of the accounting scheme used by the domain, it is not case sensitive. The default value varies according to domains. The default value is restored when the node is deleted.

access-limit.description: Domain max access number. The default value is defined in the PAF file and is restored when the node is deleted.

radius-server-template.description: Name of the RADIUS server used by the domain, it is not case sensitive.

hwtacacs-server-template.description: Name of the HWTACACS server used by the domain, it is not case sensitive.

time-range-enable.description: Enable/disable the time range function used by a domain.

service-terminal.description: Enable/disable users to log in Terminal mode.

service-telnet.description: Enable/disable users to log in Telnet mode.

service-ftp.description: Enable/disable users to log in FTP mode.

service-ppp.description: Enable/disable users to log in PPP mode.

service-ssh.description: Enable/disable users to log in SSH mode.

service-qx.description: Enable/disable users to log in QX mode.

service-snmp.description: Enable/disable users to log in SNMP mode.

service-mml.description: Enable/disable users to log in MML mode.

service-http.description: Enable/disable users to log in HTTP mode.

ipv4-basic-access.description: Configure the IPv4 basic access domain.

max-user-reauth-time.description: Configure the maximum reauthentication time of a domain.

time.description: Sets the maximum reauthentication time of a domain.

ip-pools.description: List of ip pools bound to the domain.

ip-pool.description: Configure the list of IP address pools bound to the domain.

name.description: Specifies the name of an IP address pool.

accounting-copy-radius.description: Configure RADIUS server group to send accounting packets of a domain.

name.description: Enables the system to send accounting packets of a domain to a configured RADIUS server group.

realtime-accounting-copy.description: Enable/disable users' real-time accounting packets not copied to the RADIUS server.

dns-server.description: Configure the IP address of the DNS server.

primary-ip.description: Specifies the IP address of the primary DNS server.

secondary-ip.description: Specifies the IP address of the secondary DNS server.

nbns-server.description: Configure the IP address of the nbns server.

user-max-session.description: Configure the maximum number of users.

number.description: Specifies the maximum number of users that can use the same user account.

local-user-name-case-insensitive.description: Enable/disable the local user account is case-insensitive.

ip-unr-route-tag.description: Configure a route tag for host routes of IPv4 users and network segment routes generated based on the Framed-Route attribute delivered by the RADIUS server.

user-detect.description: Configure a user group in the domain.

retransmit-time.description: Indicates the number of times for detecting users by sending ARP packets.

interval.description: Indicates the interval for detecting users by sending ARP packets.

user-basic-service-ip-type.description: Configure the user basic service type.

ipv4.description: Enable/disable the user basic service type is IPv4.

ipv6.description: Enable/disable the user basic service type is IPv6.

ipv6-pd.description: Enable/disable the user basic service type is IPv6 PD.

cui.description: Configure users in a domain to apply to the RADIUS server for the CUI attribute when requesting to get online, and then adds the CUI attribute to the subsequent user accounting packets.

enable.description: Enable/disable users in a domain to apply to the RADIUS server for the CUI attribute when requesting to get online, and then adds the CUI attribute to the subsequent user accounting packets.

layer2-user-priority.description: The layer 2 users priority in which an IP address pool assigns IP addresses.

layer3-user-priority.description: The layer 3 users priority in which an IP address pool assigns IP addresses.

user-type.description: Specifies the type of a user.

accounting-exclude-vlan.description: Configure the router to exclude VLAN header length from packet length when collecting statistics about user packet bytes. This command applies to both IPv4 and IPv6 packet statistics.

annex.description: Configure string information to the left/right side of a domain name when the BRAS sends authentication and accounting request packets to the RADIUS server.

direction.description: Adds string information to the left or right side.

string.description: Specifies the string added to the DHCP option 125 attribute.

enable.description: Enable/disable MAC address authentication.

ip-pool-groups.description: List of the address pool group in a domain.

name.description: Specifies the name of an IP address pool.

framed-ip-urpf.description: Configure URPF when IP addresses are delivered by the RADIUS server.

enable.description: Enable/disable URPF when IP addresses are delivered by the radius server.

map-priority.description: Configure a device to preferentially assign MAP-T prefixes to users.

map-t-priority.description: Enable/disable MAP priority in a domain.

cut-time.description: Specifies the period after which the user connection is torn down.

rate.description: Specifies the amount of user traffic rate. If the user traffic rate is less than the amount, the user is considered idle.

zero-rate.description: Indicates that if the time when the user traffic rate is less than 1Kbyte/min reaches the idle-time value, the system will disconnect the idle user.

cut-flow-direction.description: Indicates that the parameter idle takes effect on the upstream or downstream traffic.

offline.description: Forces the users to go offline.

online.description: Allows the users to remain online.

url.description: Specifies the URL for forcible redirection.

stop-accounting.description: Indicates that a user sends an accounting-stop packet after the user is redirected because the quota of the user is used up.

enable.description: Indicates that a user sends real-time accounting packets after the quota of the user is used up.

any-address-release.description: Configure a device to forcibly log out a dual-stack user if the user releases any IP address.

offline.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly log out a dual-stack user if the user releases any IP address.

public-ip-address-pool-usage-threshold.description: Configure threshold for public IP address pool usage in an AAA domain.

lower.description: Lower threshold for public IP address pool usage in an AAA domain.

upper.description: Upper threshold for public IP address pool usage in an AAA domain.

both-cgn.description: Enable/disable threshold in an AAA domain. The public IP address pool status is determined by the address pool usage in both CGN and non-CGN scenarios. By default, the public IP address pool status is safe in non-CGN scenarios.

user-volume-quato.description: Configure a user traffic volume quota to upstream or downstream traffic.

direction.description: User flow quota applying direction. By default, the user traffic volume quota applies to both upstream and downstream traffic.

accounting-start-delay.description: Configure a device to send an accounting-start packet about a dual-stack user after a specified delay.

ipv4-immediately.description: Enable/disable accounting immediately when the IPv4 stack is online.

delay-policy.description: Configure a device to send an accounting-start packet about a dual-stack user after a specified delay for user.

time.description: Specifies a delay in sending accounting-start packets.

user-type.description: User type for enable a device to send an accounting-start packet about a dual-stack user after a specified delay.

non-accouting-time-range.description: Configure the name of a time range for non-accounting.

pre-auth-radius-server-groups.description: List of RADIUS server group to use for pre-authentication in a domain.

radius-server-group-name.description: Specifies a RADIUS server group to use for pre-authentication.

l2tp.description: Configure l2tp to aaa domain model.

domain-radius-force-enable.description: Configure the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server for the domain users.

items.description: Configure the name of an L2TP group.

qos-profile.description: Configure a QoS profile to an AAA domain for L2TP users.

inbound-profile-name.description: Specifies the name of a QoS profile to the incoming traffic of an AAA domain for L2TP users. If a QoS profile is bound to an upstream 4cos flow queue, it cannot be applied by qos-profile inbound lns-gts.

outbound-profile-name.description: Specifies the name of a QoS profile to the outgoing traffic of an AAA domain for L2TP users. If a QoS profile is bound to an downstream 4cos flow queue, it cannot be applied by qos-profile outbound lns-gts.

dslam-connect-speed.description: Configure an LAC to encapsulate the DSLAM's upstream and downstream rates respectively into the AVP24 and AVP3 attributes of packets to be sent to an LNS.

connect-speed-enable.description: Enables an LAC to encapsulate the DSLAM's upstream and downstream rates respectively into the AVP24 and AVP3 attributes of packets to be sent to an LNS.

tunnel-account-rfc-2867.description: Configure that after the accounting defined by RFC 2867 for tunnel users is enabled, the accounting packets for the tunnel and users in the tunnel are sent to the authentication server based on the format defined by RFC 2867.

account-enable.description: Enables the accounting defined by RFC 2867 for tunnel users.

priority-car-of-tcp-ack-no-payload.description: Configure the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload.

lns-priority-car.description: Enable/disable the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload of LNS users.

lns-edsg-ipv4.description: Enable/disable the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload of LNS users, who set edsg service and whose IP type is IPv4.

lns-edsg-ipv4-and-ipv6.description: Enable/disable the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload of LNS users, who set edsg service and whose IP type is IPv4/IPv6.

authentication-scheme.description: Configure authentication scheme. The default authentication scheme cannot be deleted.

first-authen-mode.description: Preferred authentication mode. The second, third, or fourth authentication mode is used only when the first authentication mode does not respond. The first authentication mode cannot be set to unavailable.

second-authen-mode.description: Authentication mode with the preference lower than the first authentication mode. The second authentication mode is used when the first authentication mode does not respond. If the setting of the second authentication mode is unavailable, the third and fourth authentication modes fail to be set.

third-authen-mode.description: Authentication mode with the preference lower than the first and second authentication modes. The third authentication mode is used when the first and second authentication modes do not respond. If the setting of the third authentication mode is unavailable, the fourth authentication mode fails to be set.

fourth-authen-mode.description: Authentication mode with the least preference. The fourth authentication mode is used when the first, second, and third authentication modes do not respond. If the setting of the fourth authentication mode is unavailable or the fourth authentication mode does not respond, the authentication fails.

authorization-scheme.description: Configure authorization scheme. The default authorization scheme cannot be deleted.

author-scheme-name.description: Name of an authorization scheme. The name uniquely identifies the authorization scheme and can be used in the domain.

first-author-mode.description: Preferred authorization mode. The second, third, or fourth authorization mode can be used only when the first authorization mode does not respond. The first authorization mode must be available.

second-author-mode.description: Authorization mode with the preference next to the first authorization mode. It is used when the first authorization mode does not respond. If the setting of the second authorization mode is unavailable, the third and fourth authorization modes fail to be set.

third-author-mode.description: Authorization mode with the preference next to the first and second authorization modes. It is used when the first and second authorization modes do not respond. If the setting of the third authorization mode is unavailable, the fourth authorization mode fails to be set.

fourth-author-mode.description: Authorization mode with the least preference. It is used when the first, second, and third authorization modes do not respond. If the setting of the fourth authorization mode is unavailable or the fourth authorization mode does not respond, the authorization fails.

radius-server-group-name.description: Specifies a RADIUS server group to use for pre-authentication.

l2tp.description: Configure l2tp to aaa domain model.

domain-radius-force-enable.description: Configure the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server for the domain users.

radius-force-enable.description: Enable/disable the L2TP attributes delivered by the RADIUS server for the domain users.

authorization.description: Configure the domain name-based authorization for L2TP users.

password.description: The password is a string ranging from 1 to 16 characters for a plaintext password and 1 to 128 characters for a ciphertext password.

groups.description: Configure an L2TP group in the domain on the LAC.

items.description: Configure the name of an L2TP group.

qos-profile.description: Configure a QoS profile to an AAA domain for L2TP users.

inbound-profile-name.description: Specifies the name of a QoS profile to the incoming traffic of an AAA domain for L2TP users. If a QoS profile is bound to an upstream 4cos flow queue, it cannot be applied by qos-profile inbound lns-gts.

outbound-profile-name.description: Specifies the name of a QoS profile to the outgoing traffic of an AAA domain for L2TP users. If a QoS profile is bound to an downstream 4cos flow queue, it cannot be applied by qos-profile outbound lns-gts.

dslam-connect-speed.description: Configure an LAC to encapsulate the DSLAM's upstream and downstream rates respectively into the AVP24 and AVP3 attributes of packets to be sent to an LNS.

connect-speed-enable.description: Enables an LAC to encapsulate the DSLAM's upstream and downstream rates respectively into the AVP24 and AVP3 attributes of packets to be sent to an LNS.

tunnel-account-rfc-2867.description: Configure that after the accounting defined by RFC 2867 for tunnel users is enabled, the accounting packets for the tunnel and users in the tunnel are sent to the authentication server based on the format defined by RFC 2867.

account-enable.description: Enables the accounting defined by RFC 2867 for tunnel users.

priority-car-of-tcp-ack-no-payload.description: Configure the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload.

lns-priority-car.description: Enable/disable the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload of LNS users.

lns-edsg-ipv4.description: Enable/disable the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload of LNS users, who set edsg service and whose IP type is IPv4.

lns-edsg-ipv4-and-ipv6.description: Enable/disable the priority car of TCP ACK packet for the no payload of LNS users, who set edsg service and whose IP type is IPv4/IPv6.

ipv4-basic-access_schema.description: Configure the IPv4 basic access domain.

max-user-reauth-time.description: Configure the maximum reauthentication time of a domain.

time.description: Sets the maximum reauthentication time of a domain.

name.description: Specifies the name of an IP address pool.

name.description: Enables the system to send accounting packets of a domain to a configured RADIUS server group.

realtime-accounting-copy.description: Enable/disable users' real-time accounting packets not copied to the RADIUS server.

user-max-session.description: Configure the maximum number of users.

number.description: Specifies the maximum number of users that can use the same user account.

local-user-name-case-insensitive.description: Enable/disable the local user account is case-insensitive.

ip-unr-route-tag.description: Configure a route tag for host routes of IPv4 users and network segment routes generated based on the Framed-Route attribute delivered by the RADIUS server.

user-detect.description: Configure a user group in the domain.

retransmit-time.description: Indicates the number of times for detecting users by sending ARP packets.

ipv4.description: Enable/disable the user basic service type is IPv4.

ipv6.description: Enable/disable the user basic service type is IPv6.

ipv6-pd.description: Enable/disable the user basic service type is IPv6 PD.

cui.description: Configure users in a domain to apply to the RADIUS server for the CUI attribute when requesting to get online, and then adds the CUI attribute to the subsequent user accounting packets.

enable.description: Enable/disable users in a domain to apply to the RADIUS server for the CUI attribute when requesting to get online, and then adds the CUI attribute to the subsequent user accounting packets.

layer2-user-priority.description: The layer 2 users priority in which an IP address pool assigns IP addresses.

layer3-user-priority.description: The layer 3 users priority in which an IP address pool assigns IP addresses.

user-type.description: Specifies the type of a user.

accounting-exclude-vlan.description: Configure the router to exclude VLAN header length from packet length when collecting statistics about user packet bytes. This command applies to both IPv4 and IPv6 packet statistics.

annex.description: Configure string information to the left/right side of a domain name when the BRAS sends authentication and accounting request packets to the RADIUS server.

direction.description: Adds string information to the left or right side.

string.description: Specifies the string added to the DHCP option 125 attribute.

enable.description: Enable/disable MAC address authentication.

framed-ip-urpf.description: Configure URPF when IP addresses are delivered by the RADIUS server.

map-priority.description: Configure a device to preferentially assign MAP-T prefixes to users.

map-t-priority.description: Enable/disable MAP priority in a domain.

cut-time.description: Specifies the period after which the user connection is torn down.

rate.description: Specifies the amount of user traffic rate. If the user traffic rate is less than the amount, the user is considered idle.

zero-rate.description: Indicates that if the time when the user traffic rate is less than 1Kbyte/min reaches the idle-time value, the system will disconnect the idle user.

cut-flow-direction.description: Indicates that the parameter idle takes effect on the upstream or downstream traffic.

offline.description: Forces the users to go offline.

online.description: Allows the users to remain online.

url.description: Specifies the URL for forcible redirection.

stop-accounting.description: Indicates that a user sends an accounting-stop packet after the user is redirected because the quota of the user is used up.

enable.description: Indicates that a user sends real-time accounting packets after the quota of the user is used up.

parse-priority.description: Specifies priorities for parsing domain names.

realm-location.description: Specifies a position for a realm domain name.

real-name-delimiter.description: Specifies a realm name delimiter used to parse the user account. The value is a single character. It can be one of the following symbols: back-slant, /, :, <, >, |, @, %, '.

real-name-parse-direction.description: Specifies a parsing direction for the realm name.

roam-character.description: Specifies an identifier for a roaming user. The value is a single character. It can be one of the following symbols: back-slant, /, :, *, <, >, |.

system-record-scheme.description: Configures a solution to record system events. Currently, only events triggered by the reboot command are recorded.

cmd-record-scheme.description: The recording scheme used by cmd recording.

system-record-scheme.description: Configures a solution to record system events. Currently, only events triggered by the reboot command are recorded.

outbound-record-scheme.description: Records remote login operations for the device that functions as the client.

online-offline-rec-switch_schema.description: Configure whether to enable login failure and logout recording for management users.

logout-rec-switch.description: Enables recording of normal and abnormal logouts.

abnormal-offline-hidens_schema.description: List of the function that replaces the abnormal offline reason with 'the user requests to go offline'.

abnormal-offline-hiden.description: Configure the function that replaces the abnormal offline reason with 'the user requests to go offline'.

hidden-id.description: Specifies an ID for an abnormal logout reason.
Specifies an ID for an abnormal logout reason.

login-failed-limit_schema.description: Configure the maximum number of login attempts allowed in the specified period.

failed-times.description: Indicates the consecutive failure times. 0 indicates that the number of times that a user fails authentication continuously is not restricted.

period.description: Specifies a period for consecutive authentication failures.

reactive-time.description: Specifies an automatic activation time for a locked account. 0 indicates that the locked account will not be unlocked automatically.

user-security-policy_schema.description: Configure a local user security policy.

user-aging-period.description: Specifies an aging period for an administrator.

user-name-min-len.description: Specifies the minimum length for user names. 0 indicates that the length is not limited.

password-policy_schema.description: Configure a local user password policy.

expire-days.description: Specifies an expiration period for a password. 0 indicates that a password is permanently valid.

prompt-days.description: Specifies a remaining validity period for a password.

change-check.description: Enable/disable mandatory password change when a password is used for the first time.

pwd-min-length.description: Specifies the minimum length for passwords configured for local users.

name.description: Name of a local user. The minimum length of a username is determined by user-name-min-len and security-policy. If security-policy is set to false and user-name-min-len is configured, the configuration takes effect. When security-policy is set to true, the minimum length of the username must be at least 6 characters. If user-name-min-len is configured and the user-name-min-len value is greater than 6 characters, the minimum length of the username is equal to the user-name-min-len value. If security-policy is set to false and user-name-min-len is not configured, the minimum length of the username is 1. If the username contains more than 32 characters, service-snmp cannot be set to true.

end-life-date.description: The end date of local user's life.

is-login-anytime.description: Enable/disable the flag of login anytime.

begin-login-day.description: The begin day of week for login.

end-login-day.description: The end day of week for login.

begin-login-time.description: The begin time of every login day. The begin-login-time must be five or more minutes earlier than the end-login-time.

end-login-time.description: The end time of every login day. The end-login-time must be five or more minutes later than the begin-login-time.

aging-in-days.description: The user will age if not online in the special days.

password-expire-in-days.description: The passowrd will expire in the special days.

group-name.description: Name of the user group where the user belongs, it must be an existing user group. The user inherits all the rights of the user group.

failed-times.description: When user continuous authen failed times reach the limit, the user is locked.

interval.description: Set a user lockout period (in minutes). If a user is locked due to consecutive authentication failures, the user is automatically unlocked after the set period expires. 0 indicats that the locked user is not automatically unlocked.

password-type.description: Set a password type, which can be cipher or irreversible-cipher. Cipher passwords are encrypted and generated using the reversible algorithm, while irreversible-cipher passwords are encrypted and generated using the irreversible algorithm.

password.description: Login password of a user, which is a string ranging from 1 to 128 characters for a unencrypted password and 32 to 268 characters for a encrypted password. The password can contain letters, numbers, and special characters. Chinese characters are not supported. The minimum length and complexity of a user password are restricted by pwd-min-length, security-policy, complexity-check, and forbidden-word. When security-policy is set to true, the minimum length of a password is 8 characters. In addition, complexity verification is enabled. The complexity requirements are as follows: (1) A password must contain digits, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, and special characters. Spaces and question marks are not supported. If the password is enclosed in quotation marks, spaces are allowed in the password. (2) The password cannot contain an account or the reverse string of an account. (3) The new password cannot be the same as any of the previous 10 passwords. (If the new password is the same as the current password, the new password is also considered as a history password. That is, the current password is included in the 10 history passwords.) This parameter takes effect when the password complexity check is enabled (complexity-check is set to true). If forbidden-word is configured, the password cannot contain forbidden words. If only the pwd-min-length value is set, the pwd-min-length setting takes effect. If the minimum length of a user password is set and the user security policy is enabled, the minimum length of a password cannot be less than 8 characters. If the minimum length of a password is set and the pwd-min-length value is greater than 8 characters, the minimum length of a password is determined by the pwd-min-length value.

level.description: Login level of a local user. If the command level adjustment function is disabled, the value of userLevel ranges from 0 to 3. If the command level adjustment function is enabled, the value of userLevel ranges from 0 to 15.

max-access-num.description: The local user max access number.

idle-cut-enable.description: Enable/disable configures the idle cut function for a local user.

begin-life-date.description: The begin date of local user's life.

is-aged.description: Whether the user is aged now.

is-locked.description: Whether the user is locked now.

left-lock-time.description: Left lock time of locked user.

is-terminal-locked.description: Whether the user is terminal locked now.

terminal-left-lock-time.description: Left lock time of terminal locked user.

is-pass-expired.description: Whether the password of this user name expires.

is-pass-changed.description: Whether the password of this user name is changed by the user.

alive-num.description: Online number of the local user.

name.description: Name of a local user. The minimum length of a username is determined by user-name-min-len and security-policy. If security-policy is set to false and user-name-min-len is configured, the configuration takes effect. When security-policy is set to true, the minimum length of the username must be at least 6 characters. If user-name-min-len is configured and the user-name-min-len value is greater than 6 characters, the minimum length of the username is equal to the user-name-min-len value. If security-policy is set to false and user-name-min-len is not configured, the minimum length of the username is 1. If the username contains more than 32 characters, service-snmp cannot be set to true.

end-life-date.description: The end date of local user's life.

is-login-anytime.description: Enable/disable the flag of login anytime.

begin-login-day.description: The begin day of week for login.

end-login-day.description: The end day of week for login.

begin-login-time.description: The begin time of every login day. The begin-login-time must be five or more minutes earlier than the end-login-time.

end-login-time.description: The end time of every login day. The end-login-time must be five or more minutes later than the begin-login-time.

aging-in-days.description: The user will age if not online in the special days.

password-expire-in-days.description: The passowrd will expire in the special days.

group-name.description: Name of the user group where the user belongs, it must be an existing user group. The user inherits all the rights of the user group.

failed-times.description: When user continuous authen failed times reach the limit, the user is locked.

interval.description: Set a user lockout period (in minutes). If a user is locked due to consecutive authentication failures, the user is automatically unlocked after the set period expires. 0 indicats that the locked user is not automatically unlocked.

password-type.description: Set a password type, which can be cipher or irreversible-cipher. Cipher passwords are encrypted and generated using the reversible algorithm, while irreversible-cipher passwords are encrypted and generated using the irreversible algorithm.

step.description: Indicates the step of the number of access users. Each time the number of access users on the router increases by the number specified by step value, the response delay is prolonged. The response delay for the access users within the step range is the same.

minimum.description: Indicates the minimum response delay for access users on the minimum-time specifies the minimum response delay.

maximum.description: Indicates the maximum response delay for access users on the maximum-time specifies the maximum response delay.

maximum.description: Indicates the maximum response delay for access users on the maximum-time specifies the maximum response delay.

accounting-include-hw-dhcp-option.description: Configure the device to send options in the hw-dhcp-option and hw-dhcpv6-option attribute.

items.description: Configure the device to send IPv4 DHCP options in the hw-dhcp-option attribute of accounting requests.
Configure the device to send IPv6 DHCP options in the hw-dhcpv6-option attribute of accounting requests.

version-type.description: Configure the RADIUS version used between the router and a RADIUS server.

type.description: The RADIUS version used between the router and a RADIUS server.

interim-accout-resend-count.description: Enables RADIUS real-time accounting packet caching and configures the number of real-time accounting packet retransmissions.

start-accout-resend-count.description: Configure the number of times that cached accounting-start packets are retransmitted to the RADIUS accounting server in a RADIUS server group.

stop-accout-resend-count.description: Configure the number of times that cached accounting-stop packets are retransmitted to the RADIUS accounting server in a RADIUS server group.

packet-priority.description: Sets the DSCP value for RADIUS packets sent by the device to a RADIUS server.

vas-account-packed-max-length.description: Sets the maximum length for a post-merging accounting packet for value-added services.

ncp-up-send-start-account.description: Enable/disable the router to send Accounting Start packets to the RADIUS server after NCP goes Up for PPPv6 users that use DHCPv6 to obtain IPv6 addresses.

test-aaa-send-account-start.description: Enable/disable the router to send Accounting Start packets to the RADIUS server upon the test-aaa command execution.

encode-option61-to-attribute153.description: Enable/disable the device to encapsulate the Option61 field into the No.153 proprietary attribute on the RADIUS server, hw-user-mac attribute.

decode-fail-ignore-hw-data-filter.description: Enable/disable a device to ignore a RADIUS attribute if the device fails to parse this attribute.

frame-ip-mask.description: Enable/disable a device to add a 32-bit Framed-IP-Netmask attribute to an Accounting-Request packet. By default, an Accounting-Request packet does not carry a 32-bit Framed-IP-Netmask attribute.

service-type-outbound-vas-enable.description: Enable/disable the value-added-service when the Service-Type attribute value as 5 in common IPoE users' authentication and accounting request packets sent to the RADIUS server.

attribute-format-called-station-id.description: Enable/disable RADIUS attribute format of Called-Station-Id.

include-type.description: Radius server attribute format of called-station-id.

head-delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Called-Station-Id include delimiter.

include-attributes.description: List of the user-defined format of the Called-Station-Id attributes.

include-attribute.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Called-Station-Id attribute.

attribute-type.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter one.

delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter.

attribute-format-calling-station-id.description: Configure radius server attribute format of calling-station-id.

include-type.description: Radius server attribute format of calling-station-id.

head-delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Calling-Station-Id include delimiter.

include-attributes.description: List of the user-defined format of the Calling-Station-Id attributes.

include-attribute.description: Configure the user-defined format of the Calling-Station-Id attribute.

attribute-type.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter one.

delimiter.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter.

attribute-calling-station-id-lns-default.description: Configure the LNS to encapsulate the Calling-Station-Id attribute into RADIUS authentication and accounting packets in the default version1 format.

lns-version.description: Configure the LNS to encapsulate the Calling-Station-Id attribute into RADIUS authentication and accounting packets in the default version1 format.

attribute-vendor-id.description: Enable/disable the ID of a vendor whose private RADIUS attribute the device can parse.

nas-port-id-format.description: Configure the format of the NAS-Port or NAS-Port-Id attribute.

format.description: Configure the format of the NAS-Port or NAS-Port-Id attribute.

vendor-id.description: Specifies the ID of a supplier.

vendor-version.description: Indicates the version format for specified vendor to encapsulate the NAS-Port-Id attribute.

attribute-include-nas.description: Configure the automatic LAC receiving NAS-PORT attribute.

nas-port-enable.description: Enable/disable the automatic LAC receiving NAS-PORT attribute.

with-user-id-accounting-request.description: Enable/disable encapsulate type in the nas-port Attribute.

traffic-unit.description: Sets the traffic unit for a RADIUS server.

packet-format.description: Configure the format of packets that inform the upstream device of the link ID.

password-type.description: Sets the mode in which the RADIUS server sends a tunnel password to simple text or cipher.

refer-option82.description: Enable/disable authentication and accounting request packets to use the Connect-Info attribute to carry the uplink and downlink rates negotiated between the BRAS and DSLAM.

sub-slot.description: Enable/disable the system to use the interface number format of slot number/sub-slot number/interface number in the calling-station-ID and NAS-port-ID attributes.

nas-port-value.description: Enables the system to use the NAS-port-ID attributes.

if-domain-blocked.description: Configure an access policy for users if the domain delivered by the RADIUS server is blocked.

author-reply-user-name-policy.description: Enable/disable the device to reply with a CoA/DM response packet that carries the same user name as that in a CoA/DM request packet.

local-coa-enable.description: Enable/disable a user name adding policy for CoA response packets.

local-dm-enable.description: Enable/disable a user name adding policy for DM response packets.

update-domain-name.description: Enable/disable devices in a RADIUS server group to replace the domain name carried in a user name with the domain name delivered by the RADIUS server.

hw-mng-ipv6-motm-enable.description: Enable/disable the encapsulation format and name of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-encapsulating-name.description: Specifies the encapsulation format and name of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-delimiter.description: Specifies a delimiter of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-exclude-local.description: Enable/disable that the local configuration is excluded of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

ipoe-user-name-apply.description: Enable/disable the router to replace the IPoE user name generated on the router with the user name delivered by the RADIUS server.

ipoe-priority-apply.description: Enable/disable RADIUS server delivered user name replaces the IPoE user name generated on the router with a higher priority than the user name in the Service identity policy.

pppoe-user-name-apply.description: Enable/disable the router to replace the PPPoE user name generated on the router with the user name delivered by the RADIUS server.

replace-ipv6-pools-with-same-type.description: Enable/disable an IPv6 address pool to be delivered by a RADIUS server using the Framed-IPv6-Pool attribute to replace the IPv6 address pools of the same type configured in a domain.

attribute-disable-account.description: Configure accounting stop packets to be sent forcibly.

flow-attributes.description: Enable/disable if you specify the flow-attributes parameter. The following RADIUS attributes are all disabled: Acct-Input-Octets, Acct-Output-Octets, Acct-Input-Packets, Acct-Output-Packets, Acct-Input-Gigawords, Acct-Output-Gigawords, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Octets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Octets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Packets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Packet, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Gigawords, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Gigawords.

hw-acct-update-address.description: Enable/disable the HW-Acct-Update-Address attribute when the attribute value is equal to a certain integer.

standard-attributes.description:
List of the standard RADIUS attributes.
Standard attributes cannot be disabled and extended attributes cannot be disabled on the same server at the same time.
Standard attributes cannot be translated and extended attributes cannot be translated on the same server at the same time.

translate-packet-type.description: Configure radius translate attributes by packet type.

translate-direction-type.description: Configure radius attributes by direction type.

disable-packet.description: Configure radius attributes by packet type.

disable-direction.description: Configure radius attributes by packet type.

items.description: Configure disable attribute for attribute value.

extend-attributes.description: List of the extend RADIUS attributes.

access-request.description: Enable/disable operate attribute for access request packet.

access-accept.description: Enable/disable operate attribute for access accept packet.

account.description: Enable/disable operate attribute for account packet.

vendor-specifics.description: List of the vendor specific RADIUS attribute.

vendor-specific.description: Configure the vendor specific RADIUS attribute.

operation-type.description: Operation type of vendor specific attribute.

radius-server-algorithm.description: Configure algorithm of a RADIUS server.

radius-arithmetic.description: Sets the algorithm of a RADIUS server.

master-backup-rule.description: Indicates the rule of the active/standby algorithm.

rollover-on-reject.description: Configure a user fails to be authenticated by a RADIUS server in the group, the router sends an Access-Request packet to another RADIUS server until the user is authenticated or fails to be authenticated by any RADIUS servers.

enable.description: Enable/disable if a user fails to be authenticated by a RADIUS server in the group, the router sends an Access-Request packet to another RADIUS server until the user is authenticated or fails to be authenticated by any RADIUS servers.

llid-fail-disable-attribute.description: Configure radius attribute of Calling-Station-Id when LLID fail.

calling-station-id.description: Enable/disable radius attribute of Calling-Station-Id when LLID fail.

decode-hw-user-password-attribute.description: Configure the simple password decryption mode for the hw-user-password attribute (Huawei-proprietary attribute 33).

simple-coa-request.description: Enable/disable the simple password decryption mode for the hw-user-password attribute (Huawei-proprietary attribute 33).

assign-hw-pcp-server.description: Configure the HW-PCP-Server-Name attribute to be encapsulated into a specified DHCP/DHCPv6 option.

vendor-attribute-multiple.description: Configure the NE40E to carry multiple proprietary attributes in RADIUS attribute 26 Vendor-Specific.

other.description: Enable/disable the other proprietary attributes except the Huawei proprietary attribute, the Microsoft proprietary attribute, the 3GPP2 proprietary attribute, the RedBack proprietary attribute and the DSLForum proprietary attribute.

calling-station-id-format.description: Enable/disable PPPoE user calling_station_id in Redback format.

version1.description: Enable/disable using when calling-station-id is configed as redback format.

version3.description: Configure the Calling-Station-Id attribute to be encapsulated in the version3 format.

authen-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in user authentication and accounting packets.

bb-caller-id.description: Enable/disable No.97 RADIUS attribute, the private attribute of REDBACK.

hw-auth-type.description: Enable/disable No.180 RADIUS attribute, indicating the authentication type of users.

hw-product-id.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.255 attribute, which is used to indicate the device type.

hw-version.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.254 attribute, which is used to indicate the system software version.

cmcc-nas-type.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.

cmcc-up-identifier.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to indicate the BRAS-UP ID.

cmcc-up-ip.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to indicate the IP address of the BRAS-UP.

avpair-subscriber-nas-type.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.

avpair-subscriber-up-identifier.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to indicate the vBRAS-UP ID.

avpair-subscriber-up-ip.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to indicate the IP address of the vBRAS-UP.

lns-authen-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in LNS user authentication and accounting packets.

nas-port-id.description: Enable/disable No.87 RADIUS attribute. It is specific to scenarios in which the LNS sends request packets that need to carry the nas-port-id attribute to the LNS RADIUS server.

accounting-on-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS Accouting-On packet.

nas-ip-address.description: Enable/disable the NAS-IP-Address attributes to be added to RADIUS accounting-on packet.

event-time-stamp.description: Enable/disable a RADIUS Accouting-On packet to carry the event-timestamp attribute.

accounting-off-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS Accouting-Off packet.

nas-ip-address.description: Enable/disable the NAS-IP-Address attributes to be added to RADIUS accounting-off packet.

event-time-stamp.description: Enable/disable a Accounting-Off packet to carry the event-timestamp attribute.

coa-nak-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a coa-nak packet.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable the public No.18 attribute, which indicates the description of return character strings.

daa-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a DAA accounting packet.

class.description: Enable/disable the public No.25 attribute, which is used to take the accounting information.

edsg-authen-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in EDSG authentication and accounting packets.

hw-product-id.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.255 attribute, which is used to indicate the device type.

hw-version.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.254 attribute, which is used to indicate the system software version.

edsg-account-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a EDSG accounting packet.

class.description: Enable/disable the public No.25 attribute, which is used to take the accounting information.

user-offline-reason.description: Enable/disable detailed user offline reason in EDSG stop accounting-request packets.

user-mac.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.153 attribute, detailed user-mac in EDSG accounting-request packets.

accounting-request-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a accounting request packet.

hw-dhcpv6-option37.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.150 attribute, which is used to encapsulate the client MAC.

edsg-service-name.description: Enable/disable the EDSG service name. If the command is configured, it indicates the Huawei proprietary No.95 attribute. If the command is not configured, it indicates the Huawei proprietary No.185 attribute.

hw-acct-terminate-subcause.description: Enable/disable No.181 RADIUS attribute, indicating the ID of a subcause for a session interruption.

hw-avpair-nat-vpn.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates the VPN instance of the CGN ip pool.

hw-avpair-nat-extend-port.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates the extended port range.

hw-avpair-subscriber-fq.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates that the hw-avpair attribute in Accounting-request packets is used for sending effective Flow-queue parameters.

hw-avpair-subscriber-vpnid.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates that the hw-avpair attribute in Accounting-request packets is used for subscriber:vpnid.

hw-vpn-instance.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 94 attribute to be carried in accounting request packets. This attribute represents the VPN instance information. Specify this parameter if the upstream device needs to identify VPN instance information of users and implement service policies based on the VPN instance information in accounting request packets.

frame-route.description: Enable/disable the public No. 22 attribute. users' route information.

hw-web-url.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 253 attribute. the web users approve compulsive website.

hw-tunnel-group-name.description: Enable/disable the Huawei-proprietary No. 96 attribute, which identifies an L2TP or GRE group name.

hw-client-primary-dns.description: Enable/disable the Huawei-proprietary No. 135 attribute, which identifies the IP address of a primary DNS server.

hw-client-secondary-dns.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 136 attribute, which identifies the IP address of a secondary DNS server.

bod-account-attribute.description: Configure the attribute of bod account.

hw-nat-ip-adress.description: Enable/disable public network IP address after network address translation (NAT).

hw-nat-start-port.description: Enable/disable starting port of the public network IP address after NAT in a centralized BRAS scenario.

hw-nat-end-port.description: Enable/disable ending port of the public network IP address after NAT in a centralized BRAS scenario.

coa-query-ack-attribute.description: Configure the attributes to be carried in the ACK packets that are replied to the RADIUS server in a COA-based query.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Reply-Message attribute saved upon CoA-based re-authentication success.

session-time-out.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Session-Timeout attribute to indicate the remaining duration of a user service.

acct-session-time.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Acct-Session-Time attribute to indicate the online duration of a user.

filter-id.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Filter-Id attribute to indicate the user group information.

access-request-attribute.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS access request packet.

hw-gateway-address.description: Enable/disable access authentication request packets of Layer 3 DHCPv4 access users to carry user gateway addresses when the packets are sent to a RADIUS server.

hw-avpair-link-address.description: Enable/disable access authentication request packets of Layer 3 DHCPv6 access users to carry the HW-AVPAIR attribute to indicate the user link-address information when the packets are sent to a RADIUS server.

coa-logon-ack-attribute.description: Configure the attributes to be carried in the ACK packets that are replied to the RADIUS server when CoA-based pre-authentication to authentication domain switchover is performed successfully.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable ACK packets to carry the Reply-Message attribute.

class-partial-match.description: Specifies the character string for approximate string matching of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-encode-format-name.description: Specifies the encapsulation format and name of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-delimiter.description: Specifies a delimiter of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-exclude-local.description: Enable/disable that the local configuration is excluded of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

if-domain-blocked.description: Configure an access policy for users if the domain delivered by the RADIUS server is blocked.

author-reply-user-name-policy.description: Enable/disable the device to reply with a CoA/DM response packet that carries the same user name as that in a CoA/DM request packet.

local-coa-enable.description: Enable/disable a user name adding policy for CoA response packets.

local-dm-enable.description: Enable/disable a user name adding policy for DM response packets.

update-domain-name.description: Enable/disable devices in a RADIUS server group to replace the domain name carried in a user name with the domain name delivered by the RADIUS server.

hw-mng-ipv6-motm-enable.description: Enable/disable the encapsulation format and name of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-encapsulating-name.description: Specifies the encapsulation format and name of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-delimiter.description: Specifies a delimiter of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

hw-mng-ipv6-exclude-local.description: Enable/disable that the local configuration is excluded of the hw-mng-IPv6 attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

ipoe-user-name-apply.description: Enable/disable the router to replace the IPoE user name generated on the router with the user name delivered by the RADIUS server.

ipoe-priority-apply.description: Enable/disable RADIUS server delivered user name replaces the IPoE user name generated on the router with a higher priority than the user name in the Service identity policy.

pppoe-user-name-apply.description: Enable/disable the router to replace the PPPoE user name generated on the router with the user name delivered by the RADIUS server.

replace-ipv6-pools-with-same-type.description: Enable/disable an IPv6 address pool to be delivered by a RADIUS server using the Framed-IPv6-Pool attribute to replace the IPv6 address pools of the same type configured in a domain.

attribute-disable-account_schema.description: Configure accounting stop packets to be sent forcibly.

flow-attributes.description: Enable/disable if you specify the flow-attributes parameter. The following RADIUS attributes are all disabled: Acct-Input-Octets, Acct-Output-Octets, Acct-Input-Packets, Acct-Output-Packets, Acct-Input-Gigawords, Acct-Output-Gigawords, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Octets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Octets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Packets, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Packet, HW-Acct-IPv6-Input-Gigawords, HW-Acct-IPv6-Output-Gigawords.

hw-acct-update-address.description: Enable/disable the HW-Acct-Update-Address attribute when the attribute value is equal to a certain integer.

standard-attributes_schema.description:
List of the standard RADIUS attributes.
Standard attributes cannot be disabled and extended attributes cannot be disabled on the same server at the same time.
Standard attributes cannot be translated and extended attributes cannot be translated on the same server at the same time.

translate-direction-type.description: Configure radius attributes by direction type.
