radius-server-algorithm_schema.description: Configure algorithm of a RADIUS server.

radius-arithmetic.description: Sets the algorithm of a RADIUS server.

master-backup-rule.description: Indicates the rule of the active/standby algorithm.

rollover-on-reject_schema.description: Configure a user fails to be authenticated by a RADIUS server in the group, the router sends an Access-Request packet to another RADIUS server until the user is authenticated or fails to be authenticated by any RADIUS servers.

enable.description: Enable/disable if a user fails to be authenticated by a RADIUS server in the group, the router sends an Access-Request packet to another RADIUS server until the user is authenticated or fails to be authenticated by any RADIUS servers.

llid-fail-disable-attribute_schema.description: Configure radius attribute of Calling-Station-Id when LLID fail.

calling-station-id.description: Enable/disable radius attribute of Calling-Station-Id when LLID fail.

decode-hw-user-password-attribute_schema.description: Configure the simple password decryption mode for the hw-user-password attribute (Huawei-proprietary attribute 33).

simple-coa-request.description: Enable/disable the simple password decryption mode for the hw-user-password attribute (Huawei-proprietary attribute 33).

assign-hw-pcp-server_schema.description: Configure the HW-PCP-Server-Name attribute to be encapsulated into a specified DHCP/DHCPv6 option.

vendor-attribute-multiple_schema.description: Configure the NE40E to carry multiple proprietary attributes in RADIUS attribute 26 Vendor-Specific.

other.description: Enable/disable the other proprietary attributes except the Huawei proprietary attribute, the Microsoft proprietary attribute, the 3GPP2 proprietary attribute, the RedBack proprietary attribute and the DSLForum proprietary attribute.

calling-station-id-format_schema.description: Enable/disable PPPoE user calling_station_id in Redback format.

version1.description: Enable/disable using when calling-station-id is configed as redback format.

version3.description: Configure the Calling-Station-Id attribute to be encapsulated in the version3 format.

authen-account-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in user authentication and accounting packets.

bb-caller-id.description: Enable/disable No.97 RADIUS attribute, the private attribute of REDBACK.

hw-auth-type.description: Enable/disable No.180 RADIUS attribute, indicating the authentication type of users.

hw-product-id.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.255 attribute, which is used to indicate the device type.

hw-version.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.254 attribute, which is used to indicate the system software version.

cmcc-nas-type.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.

cmcc-up-identifier.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to indicate the BRAS-UP ID.

cmcc-up-ip.description: Enable/disable China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to indicate the IP address of the BRAS-UP.

avpair-subscriber-nas-type.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.

avpair-subscriber-up-identifier.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to indicate the vBRAS-UP ID.

avpair-subscriber-up-ip.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair, used to indicate the IP address of the vBRAS-UP.

lns-authen-account-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in LNS user authentication and accounting packets.

nas-port-id.description: Enable/disable No.87 RADIUS attribute. It is specific to scenarios in which the LNS sends request packets that need to carry the nas-port-id attribute to the LNS RADIUS server.

accounting-on-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS Accouting-On packet.

nas-ip-address.description: Enable/disable the NAS-IP-Address attributes to be added to RADIUS accounting-on packet.

event-time-stamp.description: Enable/disable a RADIUS Accouting-On packet to carry the event-timestamp attribute.

accounting-off-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS Accouting-Off packet.

nas-ip-address.description: Enable/disable the NAS-IP-Address attributes to be added to RADIUS accounting-off packet.

event-time-stamp.description: Enable/disable a Accounting-Off packet to carry the event-timestamp attribute.

coa-nak-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a coa-nak packet.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable the public No.18 attribute, which indicates the description of return character strings.

daa-account-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a DAA accounting packet.

class.description: Enable/disable the public No.25 attribute, which is used to take the accounting information.

edsg-authen-account-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in EDSG authentication and accounting packets.

hw-product-id.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.255 attribute, which is used to indicate the device type.

hw-version.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.254 attribute, which is used to indicate the system software version.

edsg-account-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a EDSG accounting packet.

class.description: Enable/disable the public No.25 attribute, which is used to take the accounting information.

user-offline-reason.description: Enable/disable detailed user offline reason in EDSG stop accounting-request packets.

user-mac.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.153 attribute, detailed user-mac in EDSG accounting-request packets.

accounting-request-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a accounting request packet.

hw-dhcpv6-option37.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No.150 attribute, which is used to encapsulate the client MAC.

edsg-service-name.description: Enable/disable the EDSG service name. If the command is configured, it indicates the Huawei proprietary No.95 attribute. If the command is not configured, it indicates the Huawei proprietary No.185 attribute.

hw-acct-terminate-subcause.description: Enable/disable No.181 RADIUS attribute, indicating the ID of a subcause for a session interruption.

hw-avpair-nat-vpn.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates the VPN instance of the CGN ip pool.

hw-avpair-nat-extend-port.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates the extended port range.

hw-avpair-subscriber-fq.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates that the hw-avpair attribute in Accounting-request packets is used for sending effective Flow-queue parameters.

hw-avpair-subscriber-vpnid.description: Enable/disable HW-Avpair. Indicates that the hw-avpair attribute in Accounting-request packets is used for subscriber:vpnid.

hw-vpn-instance.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 94 attribute to be carried in accounting request packets. This attribute represents the VPN instance information. Specify this parameter if the upstream device needs to identify VPN instance information of users and implement service policies based on the VPN instance information in accounting request packets.

frame-route.description: Enable/disable the public No. 22 attribute. users' route information.

hw-web-url.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 253 attribute. the web users approve compulsive website.

hw-tunnel-group-name.description: Enable/disable the Huawei-proprietary No. 96 attribute, which identifies an L2TP or GRE group name.

hw-client-primary-dns.description: Enable/disable the Huawei-proprietary No. 135 attribute, which identifies the IP address of a primary DNS server.

hw-client-secondary-dns.description: Enable/disable the Huawei proprietary No. 136 attribute, which identifies the IP address of a secondary DNS server.

bod-account-attribute_schema.description: Configure the attribute of bod account.

hw-nat-ip-adress.description: Enable/disable public network IP address after network address translation (NAT).

hw-nat-start-port.description: Enable/disable starting port of the public network IP address after NAT in a centralized BRAS scenario.

hw-nat-end-port.description: Enable/disable ending port of the public network IP address after NAT in a centralized BRAS scenario.

coa-query-ack-attribute_schema.description: Configure the attributes to be carried in the ACK packets that are replied to the RADIUS server in a COA-based query.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Reply-Message attribute saved upon CoA-based re-authentication success.

session-time-out.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Session-Timeout attribute to indicate the remaining duration of a user service.

acct-session-time.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Acct-Session-Time attribute to indicate the online duration of a user.

filter-id.description: Enable/disable CoA query ACK packets to carry the Filter-Id attribute to indicate the user group information.

access-request-attribute_schema.description: Configure a attribute to be carried in a RADIUS access request packet.

hw-gateway-address.description: Enable/disable access authentication request packets of Layer 3 DHCPv4 access users to carry user gateway addresses when the packets are sent to a RADIUS server.

hw-avpair-link-address.description: Enable/disable access authentication request packets of Layer 3 DHCPv6 access users to carry the HW-AVPAIR attribute to indicate the user link-address information when the packets are sent to a RADIUS server.

coa-logon-ack-attribute_schema.description: Configure the attributes to be carried in the ACK packets that are replied to the RADIUS server when CoA-based pre-authentication to authentication domain switchover is performed successfully.

reply-message.description: Enable/disable ACK packets to carry the Reply-Message attribute.

class-partial-match.description: Specifies the character string for approximate string matching of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-encode-format-name.description: Specifies the encapsulation format and name of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-delimiter.description: Specifies a delimiter of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

class-exclude-local.description: Enable/disable that the local configuration is excluded of the class attribute to be encapsulated into a PPP packet's MTOM field.

nas-port-id_schema.description: Configure the nas-port-id attribute of the RADIUS server can carry the IP address of the DSLAM recorded by the physical port description. After the configuration, the nas-port-id attribute of the RADIUS server is encapsulated according to the configuration format.

delimiter.description: Configures the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter.

head-delimiter.description: Configures the user-defined format of the nas-port-id include delimiter.

lns-nas-ip-address_schema.description: Configure a LNS or LTS to encapsulate the remote IP address into the NAS-Ip-Address attribute of a RADIUS packet.

remote-ip-enable.description: Enable/disable a LNS or LTS to encapsulate the remote IP address into the NAS-Ip-Address attribute of a RADIUS packet.

lts-tunnel-format-vendor_schema.description: Configure a vendor-specific encapsulation format for LTS user tunnel attributes.

redback-encapsulation.description: Enable/disable the Redback encapsulation format for LTS user tunnel attributes.

lns-nas-port-id_schema.description: Configure the format of the nas-port-id attribute sent by the L2TP LNS to the RADIUS server.

include-attributes.description: List of the user-defined format of the attributes.

include-attribute.description: Configure the user-defined format of the attribute.

attribute-type.description: Configures the user-defined format of the nas-port-id attribute type.

delimiter.description: Configures the user-defined format of the attribute delimiter one.

string-or-delimiter.description: Configures the format of the nas-port-id.

ipv4-address.description: Specifies the IP address of a RADIUS authorization server.

vpn-name.description: Indicates the VPN instance to which the RADIUS authorization server belongs.

shared-key.description: Specifies the shared key for the RADIUS server. The simple password length ranges from 1 to 128, and the cipher password length ranges from 1 to 268.

destination-ip-address.description: Specifies the IP address of dynamic authorization packets.

destination-port.description: Specifies the port number of dynamic authorization packets.

server-group-name.description: Specifies the name of the RADIUS server group corresponding to the RADIUS authorization server.

ack-reserved-interval.description: Specifies the period when the authorization acknowledgment packets are saved.

enable.description: Enable/disable changing the default maximum length of RADIUS packets that can be sent by the router so that the router can communicate with devices of other vendors.

user-number.description: Specifies the number of users for each packet retransmission.

time-out.description: Specifies an interval at which cached RADIUS accounting packets are retransmitted.

account-cache-warning-threshold_schema.description: Enable/disable the accounting packet cache alarm function and Configure an alarm threshold and a clear alarm threshold. If the accounting packet cache usage reaches the configured alarm threshold, an alarm is reported.

accounting-server-statistics_schema.description: List of packet statistics on the RADIUS server with a specified IP address.

accounting-server-statistic.description: Statistics of packets on the RADIUS server with a specified IP address.

server-address.description: The IP address of the RADIUS accounting server referred to in this table entry.

server-index.description: A number uniquely identifying each RADIUS Accounting server with which this client communicates.

client-server-port-number.description: The UDP port the client is using to send requests to this server.

client-round-trip-time.description: The time interval between the most recent Accounting-Response and the Accounting-Request that matched it from this RADIUS accounting server.

client-requests.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Request packets sent. This does not include retransmissions.

client-retransmissions.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Request packets retransmitted to this RADIUS accounting server. Retransmissions include retries where the Identifier and Acct-Delay have been updated, as well as those in which they remain the same.

client-responses.description: The number of RADIUS packets received on the accounting port from this server.

client-malformed-responses.description: The number of malformed RADIUS Accounting-Response packets received from this server. Malformed packets include packets with an invalid length. Bad authenticators and unknown types are not included as malformed accounting responses.

invalid-authenticators.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Response packets which contained invalid authenticators received from this server.

client-pending-requests.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Request packets sent to this server that have not yet timed out or received a response. This variable is incremented when an Accounting-Request is sent and decremented due to receipt of an Accounting-Response, a timeout or a retransmission.

client-timeouts.description: The number of accounting timeouts to this server. After a timeout the client may retry to the same server, send to a different server, or give up. A retry to the same server is counted as a retransmit as well as a timeout. A send to a different server is counted as an Accounting-Request as well as a timeout.

client-unknown-packets.description: The number of RADIUS packets of unknown type which were received from this server on the accounting port.

client-packets-dropped.description: The number of RADIUS packets which were received from this server on the accounting port and dropped for some other reason.

server-address.description: The IP address of the RADIUS accounting server referred to in this table entry.

server-index.description: A number uniquely identifying each RADIUS Accounting server with which this client communicates.

client-server-port-number.description: The UDP port the client is using to send requests to this server.

client-round-trip-time.description: The time interval between the most recent Accounting-Response and the Accounting-Request that matched it from this RADIUS accounting server.

client-requests.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Request packets sent. This does not include retransmissions.

client-retransmissions.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Request packets retransmitted to this RADIUS accounting server. Retransmissions include retries where the Identifier and Acct-Delay have been updated, as well as those in which they remain the same.

client-responses.description: The number of RADIUS packets received on the accounting port from this server.

client-malformed-responses.description: The number of malformed RADIUS Accounting-Response packets received from this server. Malformed packets include packets with an invalid length. Bad authenticators and unknown types are not included as malformed accounting responses.

invalid-authenticators.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Response packets which contained invalid authenticators received from this server.

client-pending-requests.description: The number of RADIUS Accounting-Request packets sent to this server that have not yet timed out or received a response. This variable is incremented when an Accounting-Request is sent and decremented due to receipt of an Accounting-Response, a timeout or a retransmission.

client-timeouts.description: The number of accounting timeouts to this server. After a timeout the client may retry to the same server, send to a different server, or give up. A retry to the same server is counted as a retransmit as well as a timeout. A send to a different server is counted as an Accounting-Request as well as a timeout.

client-unknown-packets.description: The number of RADIUS packets of unknown type which were received from this server on the accounting port.

client-packets-dropped.description: The number of RADIUS packets which were received from this server on the accounting port and dropped for some other reason.

backup-group.description: Configure one vBRAS-UP's interface and another vBRAS-UP's interface as a hot backup group on a vBRAS-CP. If the backup groups bound to a backup policy template share a remote four-dimensional interface pool, a bound remote four-dimensional interface cannot be used by other backup groups, regardless of the type of the backup policy template. The UPIDs of the interfaces configured for the backup groups bound to a backup policy template must be bound to the same UP backup group. The primary backup interface and secondary backup interface in a backup group must have dufferebt UPIDs. In the same policy template, if the backup groups are bound to sub-interfaces, the primary backup interfaces of the backup groups must have the same UPID, and the secondary backup interfaces of the backup groups must have the same UPID.

master-profile-interface.description: Configure a master interface. If the backup groups bound to a backup policy template share a remote four-dimensional interface pool, a bound remote four-dimensional interface cannot be used by other backup groups, regardless of the type of the backup policy template. The UPIDs of the interfaces configured for the backup groups bound to a backup policy template must be bound to the same UP backup group. The primary backup interface and secondary backup interface in a backup group must have dufferebt UPIDs.

slave-profile-interface.description: Configure a slave interface. If the backup groups bound to a backup policy template share a remote four-dimensional interface pool, a bound remote four-dimensional interface cannot be used by other backup groups, regardless of the type of the backup policy template. The UPIDs of the interfaces configured for the backup groups bound to a backup policy template must be bound to the same UP backup group. The primary backup interface and secondary backup interface in a backup group must have dufferebt UPIDs.

backup-group.description: Configure one vBRAS-UP's interface and another vBRAS-UP's interface as a hot backup group on a vBRAS-CP. If the backup groups bound to a backup policy template share a remote four-dimensional interface pool, a bound remote four-dimensional interface cannot be used by other backup groups, regardless of the type of the backup policy template. The UPIDs of the interfaces configured for the backup groups bound to a backup policy template must be bound to the same UP backup group. The primary backup interface and secondary backup interface in a backup group must have dufferebt UPIDs. In the same policy template, if the backup groups are bound to sub-interfaces, the primary backup interfaces of the backup groups must have the same UPID, and the secondary backup interfaces of the backup groups must have the same UPID.
